title: 108_s121
content: The Act may be cited as the "National AMBER Alert Network Act of 2003" and it involves the national coordination of AMBER Alert communications network. The "National AMBER Alert Network Act of 2003" mandates the appointment of an AMBER Alert Coordinator within the Department of Justice to oversee the national AMBER Alert communications network for abducted children. The Coordinator's duties include closing network gaps, promoting local AMBER plans, ensuring regional coordination, and serving as the nationwide contact for network development. The AMBER Alert Coordinator oversees the development and regional coordination of alerts on abducted children through the network. They consult with the FBI Director on each child abduction alert and cooperate with the Secretary of Transportation and the FCC. Minimum standards for issuing and disseminating alerts through the AMBER Alert Communications Network are outlined in Section 3. The AMBER Alert Coordinator of the Department of Justice will establish voluntary minimum standards for issuing and disseminating alerts through the AMBER Alert communications network, with a focus on limiting dissemination to geographic areas most likely to aid in the recovery of abducted children. The Coordinator must not interfere with the current voluntary system. The Coordinator must cooperate with the Secretary of Transportation, the FCC, local broadcasters, and law enforcement agencies to establish minimum standards for the AMBER Alert communications network. Grant program established for notification and communications systems along highways to aid in the recovery of abducted children. The Secretary of Transportation will provide grants to States for notification systems along highways to aid in recovering abducted children. Activities may include electronic message boards and dissemination of alerts. Federal funding may cover up to 50% of costs. The Secretary of Transportation will distribute grants equitably across the US for notification systems to aid in recovering abducted children. The Secretary will set requirements for grant applications and authorize $20,000,000 for fiscal year 2004 for this program. Grant program established for supporting Amber Alert communications plans. The Attorney General will provide grants to States for AMBER Alert communications plans. Activities may include education and training programs, law enforcement programs, and other appropriate support activities. The Federal share of funding for these activities cannot exceed 50 percent. The Attorney General will distribute grants under the AMBER Alert program on a geographic basis to ensure equitable distribution. Requirements for grants, including application procedures, will be set by the Attorney General. $5,000,000 is authorized for the Department of Justice in fiscal year 2004 for this program, with funds remaining available until expended. Passed the Senate January 21, 2003. Attest: EMILY J. REYNOLDS, Secretary.
